COMMAND.NAME: setfont
COMMAND.PARAMETER: windowName The name of the e93 window this command will act upon.

DESCRIPTION.P:
Change the font used by a window. If the font cannot be located, default to one that can.
e93 for Windows uses the X Logical Font Description (XLFD) format.
-*-Courier-bold-i-normal-*-12-*-*-*-*-*
This is the same format that e93 X Windows and TK use.

An easy way to get this information is to use the command fontdialog. This will bring up a font dialog box that allows you to choose a font, its size, and attributes. It will return the editor specific font string for the font you selected.

COMMAND.STATUS:
This command will return an error in the following cases:
windowName is not provided.
windowName is not an e93 window.
